intro: Spiranthes elytra, commonly known as the narrow-leaf ladies' tresses, is a flowering plant belonging to the orchid family. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and its distinctive spiral arrangement of flowers, which give it its common name. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and wetlands. Its flowers are usually pale green to white in color and bloom in late summer. Spiranthes elytra is known for its delicate appearance and ecological importance in supporting pollinators.
